Philosophy of the law CIPA seeks to protect children (and adults) using school and public library Internet computers from visual depictions that are ❑ Obscene ❑ Child Pornography ❑ Harmful to minors

page.title:

CIPA History
page.normal_text:
The U.S. District Court for the Eastern Division of Pennsylvania
The U.S. District Court for the Eastern
Division of Pennsylvania

The Children’s Internet Protection Act was declared facially unconstitutional (in the Court’s opinion the law cannot be applied in a constitutional manner).
The Children’s Internet Protection Act
was declared facially unconstitutional (in
the Court’s opinion the law cannot be
applied in a constitutional manner).

page.title:
CIPA History
CIPA History
page.normal_text:
The District Court decision changed the
The District Court decision changed the

requirements of CIPA by suspending the technology protection measure for public libraries but not for schools –
requirements of CIPA by suspending the
technology protection measure for
public libraries but not for schools –

CIPA still in affect for schools (in its
CIPA still in affect for schools (in its

entirety)
entirety)

The Federal Communications Commission is the government agency that oversees Erate.
The Federal Communications Commission is
the government agency that oversees Erate.
